body_html: This policy of only supporting the most bleeding edge dependencies is very problematic for HPC centers. Kernel module updates required for the latest Cuda versions are a much bigger deal on a supercomputer than they are on a workstation. On Blue Waters, we are still on Cuda 7.5, although we hope to get 8 at some point. We won't be getting 9. Please understand that "just run the most bleeding edge version of everything" doesn't work for everyone and makes your software "alpha" in terms of reliability.
